questions.text: A 43-year-old male received a deep intramuscular injection two days ago and now presents with difficulty walking. You note that his right hip drops every time he raises his right foot. At which location did this patient most likely receive his injection?

questions.correct_answer: C. Short arm of Y chromosome

A 68-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department with seven right hip pain after a fall. She was walking down a hallway when she slipped and fell on the floor, landing on her hip. The patient has a history of depression and Polymyalgia rheumatica. Current medications include sertraline and low-dose prednisone. She also has a 40-pack-year smoking history. Blood pressure is 145/85 mm Hg and pulse is 96/min. The patient appears to be in significant pain. She is unable to move the right hip, and the right leg appears shorter than the left. questions.text: Which of the following apolipoproteins is required to activate LPL-mediated release of fatty acids from chylomicrons?

Which of the following is TRUE? A. Entry of Na+ during the depolarization phase causes opening of more voltage-gated Na+ channels and further depolarization, setting up a positive feedback loop. B. During the rapid upstroke phase the membrane potential moves toward the equilibrium potential for Na+ (+60 mV). C. The Na+ channels rapidly enter a closed state called the inactivated state D. Efflux of K+ through slow voltage-gated K+ channels bring the action potential to an end and cause closure of their gates through a positive feedback process.

64-year-old man has serum potassium of 2.8 mEq/l (reference range, 3.5–5.0 mEq/l). Which of the following sets of changes best describe the resting membrane potential (Em) and K+ Equilibrium potential (EK) in a typical neuron in this man compared with normal? (Assume normal intracellular concentration of K +.)

options.label: A
options.text: EK, less negative; Em, less negative

options.label: B
options.text: EK, less negative; Em, more negative

options.label: C
options.text: EK, more negative; Em, less negative

options.label: D
options.text: EK, more negative; Em, more negative

questions.correct_answer: D. EK, more negative; Em, more negative

  • • • For RR or OR < 1 it is Protective factor
